info.title: Freemarket Web API
info.description:
##Overview

Our API is designed and built to allow your business to quickly and securely leverage the power our platform. Our comprehensive API documentation helps you explore our products and features in order to integrate with us as soon as possible. Additionally our dedicated technical team is here to answer any queries you may have.

All of the APIs are organised around REST - if you've interacted with a REST API previously then the concepts will be familiar to you. 

##Access

We provide Sandbox access to potential and existing clients. If you would like access to Sandbox then please contact our Sales team at: sales@wearefreemarket.com or by calling +44 (0)20 3393 2709

Returns a list of entities
Returns a single entity of type Object

200.description: When there is an alert with the provided identifier and it is cancelled.

404.description: When there is no alert with the provided identifier, or you do not have permission to cancel the alert

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The details of the Alert to be created.

201.description: When the Alert has been created successfully. The HTTP Header 'Location' will contain the URL with the details of the created Alert.

400.description: When there has been an error in any of the Alert's attributes

200.description: When there is an exchange with the provided identifier and it is allocated.

404.description: When there is no exchange with the provided identifier, or you do not have permission to view the exchange

200.description: When there is an exchange with the provided identifier and it is cancelled.

404.description: When there is no exchange with the provided identifier, or you do not have permission to view the exchange

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The details of the exchange to be created

201.description: When the exchange has been created successfully. The HTTP Header 'Location' will contain the URL with the details of the created exchange.

400.description: When there has been an error in any of the exchange's attributes

201.description: When the transfer has been created successfully. The HTTP Header 'Location' will contain the URL with the details of the created transfer.

400.description: When there has been an error in any of the transfer's attributes

200.description: When there is an Withdrawal with the provided identifier and it is cancelled.

404.description: When there is no Withdrawal with the provided identifier, or you do not have permission to view the Withdrawal

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The details of the Withdrawal to be created.

201.description: When the Withdrawal has been created successfully. The HTTP Header 'Location' will contain the URL with the details of the created Withdrawal.

400.description: When there has been an error in any of the Withdrawal's attributes

post.summary: Creates a Withdrawal configured and triggered by completion of an Instruction.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The details of the Withdrawal to be created

201.description: When the Withdrawal has been created successfully. The HTTP Header 'Location' will contain the URL with the details of the created Withdrawal.

400.description: When there has been an error in any of the Withdrawal's attributes

get.summary: Returns a list of entities of type PaymentPurposeDto

SourceCurrencyCode.description: The source currency for the exchange rate

TargetCurrencyCode.description: The target currency for the exchange rate

Limit.description: The exchange rate threashold for the alert

AccountId.description: The account id for which the beneficiary will be created

AccountHolderName.description: The name of the bank account holder

AlternatePaymentRouting.description: Alternate payment routing information for the same beneficiary to be used for possible payment optimizations.

CurrencyCode.description: The currency of the transferred funds

RationaleForTransactions.description: The payment purpose id - Id, Code or name can be provided

AccountId.description: The account id for which the exchange will be created

SourceCurrencyCode.description: The currency to be disposed of

Goal.description: The amount to be bought or sold in this exchange, depending on GoalType

GoalType.description: The type of the goal, either 'Buy' or 'Sell'

UseAvailableFunds.description: True if any available funds in the account should be used for this exchange

DepositReference.x-deprecateReason: Will be removed from future versions, use Deposits[0].Reference in case there are expected deposits for this exchange

AccountId.description: The account context for the quote

GoalType.description: The goal of the quote, either a 'Buy' or a 'Sell'

Amount.description: The amount to buy or sell

SourceCurrencyCode.description: The currency to be disposed of

AccountId.description: The account id for which the instruction will be created

BeneficiaryId.description: The beneficiary id which will receive the funds

AccountId.description: The account id for which the withdrawal will be created

Amount.description: The amount to be withdrawn. If left empty, the maximum withdrawable amount will be requested for withdrawal

BeneficiaryId.description: The beneficiary id who will receive the funds

Reference.description: The withdrawal reference, up to 35 characters

Description.description: The withdrawal description, up to 140 characters

UltimateOriginator.description: The ultimate originator. Use only if you are creating a withdrawal on behalf of another party or entity.

InstructionId.description: The instruction id which will trigger this withdrawal

BeneficiaryId.description: The beneficiary id who will receive the funds

UltimateOriginator.description: The ultimate originator. Use only if you are creating a withdrawal on behalf of another party or entity.
